meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let's get this intergalactic review party started!

I'm not going to sugarcoat it; Space Run Galaxy is an absolute blast! It's like a cosmic space-ruckus of awesomeness that will keep you hooked from the get-go. And if I do say so myself (which, let's be real, I totally am), even the most skeptical critics can't help but give it props.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What about those fancy-pants reviewers over at Brash Games?" Well, let me tell you, they weren't wrong. Legendary is a pretty accurate description of this game. It's like the Deep Purple song says: go space truckin' around the stars! The tactical depth, customization options, and frantic action make for an experience that's worth the extra effort.

But hey, I'm not just going to cherry-pick quotes from GameSpot (although, let's be real, they're a great source). Even the folks over at GameSpew agree - this game is out of this world! The open-world mission system and ship customization are like nothing else out there. And did someone say space pirates? Oh boy!

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "But what about the repetition?" Well, let me tell you, my friends, even GameWatcher - who's not exactly known for their glowing reviews - says it's a refreshing take on the tower defense genre. And I'm here to tell you that it's true! This game is all about speed and immediacy, making for a furious effort that's both challenging and rewarding.

Of course, not everyone's going to be as thrilled. Everyeye.it seems to have had some... issues with the dialogue (read: cringe-worthy). And COGconnected even gave it a nod of approval, saying it's a refreshing take on tower defense with some Asteroids flair thrown in. Even CD-Action - who gave it a meh review - admits that it can be fun for a couple dozen minutes.

So, what's the verdict? It's simple: Space Run Galaxy is an absolute blast! It's like a cosmic space-ruckus of awesomeness that will keep you hooked from the get-go. Trust me, my friends - this game is out of this world!

Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go... um, review some more games? Yeah, that's it.
